intro: Odontadenia sylvestris, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure. The plant produces distinctive yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand the harsh conditions of its natural habitat. Odontadenia sylvestris is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in nutrient-poor soils.
